title: Uber warns that tax hikes could wreck its UK business
text:
Uber has warned its UK arm could be crippled by a tax probe which might trigger a 20pc VAT charge on all bookings.

In accounts published on Tuesday, the taxi app said the HMRC investigation is one of the biggest challenges it faces.

The firm also revealed a 15pc rise in British revenues last year, up to £68m, while profits more than doubled from £2.4m to £5.1m.

In May, the taxman revealed that it was investigating Uber over allegations that it owes more than £1bn to the Exchequer.

The company does not pay VAT on its fares in the UK because it says it is a software business which connects drivers and passengers through its app, rather than a transportation provider.
